trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of objects.
The ArrangedElementCollection class represents a collection of objects arranged on a design surface or inside a parent <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ContainerControl?displayProperty=fullName>.
There are no publicly defined constructors in ArrangedElementCollection because it is designed to be used only internally within the [!INCLUDE[dnprdnshort](~/add/includes/dnprdnshort-md.md)].
However, classes derived from ArrangedElementCollection, such as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.ControlCollection?displayProperty=fullName>, are available to the developer.
Copies the entire contents of this collection to a compatible one-dimensional <xref:System.Array>, starting at the specified index of the target array.
The type of the specified array must be compatible with the source collection.
This method uses the <xref:System.Array.Copy%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to copy the elements.
The one-dimensional <xref:System.Array> that is the destination of the elements copied from the current collection.
The array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in `array` at which copying begins.
array is .
index is less than 0.
array is multidimensional.
-or- The number of elements in the source collection is greater than the available space from index to the end of array.
The type of the source element cannot be cast automatically to the type of array.
Gets the number of elements in the collection.
When required, the capacity of the collection will dynamically increase to accept more elements.
The number of elements currently contained in the collection.
Determines whether two <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection"></xref> instances are equal.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection"></xref> to compare with the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection"></xref>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection"></xref> is equal to the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection"></xref>; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
Returns an enumerator for the entire collection.
Typically the enumerator does not have exclusive access to the collection; therefore, enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread-safe procedure.
Even when a collection is synchronized, other threads could still modify the collection, which causes the enumerator to throw an exception.
To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can follow one of the following strategies: - Lock the collection during the entire enumeration using a <xref:System.Threading.Monitor>.
- Catch and handle the exceptions that result from changes made by other threads.
An <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerator> for the entire collection.
Returns the hash code for this instance.
A hash code for the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection"></xref>.
Gets a value indicating whether the collection is read-only.
A read-only collection does not allow the addition, removal, or modification of elements after the collection is created.
A read-only collection is simply a collection with a wrapper that prevents modifying the collection.
If changes are made to the underlying collection, the read-only collection reflects those changes.
<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the collection is read-only; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
For a description of this member, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.IsSynchronized%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
This method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if access to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection"></xref> is synchronized (thread safe); otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
For a description of this member, see the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection.SyncRoot%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
This method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
An object that can be used to synchronize access to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection"></xref>.
For a description of this member, see the <xref:System.Collections.IList.Add%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
This method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The <xref:System.Object> to add to the <xref:System.Collections.IList>.
The position into which the new element was inserted.
For a description of this member, see the <xref:System.Collections.IList.Clear%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
This method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.

This method is an explicit interface member implementation.

The <xref:System.Object> to locate in the <xref:System.Collections.IList>.

<xref uid="langword_csharp_true" name="true" href=""></xref> if the <xref:System.Object> is found in the <xref:System.Collections.IList>; otherwise, <xref uid="langword_csharp_false" name="false" href=""></xref>.
For a description of this member, see the <xref:System.Collections.IList.IndexOf%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.

The <xref:System.Object> to locate in the <xref:System.Collections.IList>.
The index of value if found in the list; otherwise, -1.
For a description of this member, see the <xref:System.Collections.IList.Insert%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
This method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The zero-based index at which `value` should be inserted.
The <xref:System.Object> to insert into the <xref:System.Collections.IList>.
For a description of this member, see the <xref:System.Collections.IList.IsFixedSize%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
This method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.

This method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The zero-based index of the element to get.
The element at the specified index.
For a description of this member, see the <xref:System.Collections.IList.Remove%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
This method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.

This method is an explicit interface member implementation.
It can be used only when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Layout.ArrangedElementCollection> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Collections.IList> interface.
The zero-based index of the item to remove.
